        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;

    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>

          OS:<th title="Operating System."><!---->OS:</th>

            Issue 1270470: Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature.

            Issue 1270470: Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature. 
          </h1>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>The browser behavior when a Scroll to text fragment match is found is to scroll to the part of the page containing the text match and highlight it. <span class="line"><!---->The browser behavior when a Scroll to text fragment match is found is to scroll to the part of the page containing the text match and highlight it. <!----></span><br><br>What was discussed in the security docs about possible STTF attacks is a way to detect the scrolls to exfiltrate information via an attacker controlled iframe in the page or via network monitoring or lazy loaded image.    <span class="line"><!---->What was discussed in the security docs about possible STTF attacks is a way to detect the scrolls to exfiltrate information via an attacker controlled iframe in the page or via network monitoring or lazy loaded image.    <!----></span><br><br>However, what i found allowed to detect a scroll without the need to partially have control over the targeted page. This is possible - the bug explanation next - because Scroll To Text Fragment feature is also possible inside an iframe, a malicious actor can embed a targeted page in a website in an iframe ( with a query for an STTF ), position that iframe in a way to be in the bottom of the attacker web page, then detect a scroll on the top page using onscroll EventListener.    <span class="line"><!---->However, what i found allowed to detect a scroll without the need to partially have control over the targeted page. This is possible - the bug explanation next - because Scroll To Text Fragment feature is also possible inside an iframe, a malicious actor can embed a targeted page in a website in an iframe ( with a query for an STTF ), position that iframe in a way to be in the bottom of the attacker web page, then detect a scroll on the top page using onscroll EventListener.    <!----></span><br><br>The expected behavior here is that the scroll would happen inside the iframe only ,however , it also happens in the top window and the iframe ( or any levels below it if the STTF happened in an iframe inside the iframe ). <span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior here is that the scroll would happen inside the iframe only ,however , it also happens in the top window and the iframe ( or any levels below it if the STTF happened in an iframe inside the iframe ). <!----></span><br><br>Linking this bug with the one here #1270469, this allowed to read cross-site files like authenticated javascript files and more.<span class="line"><!---->Linking this bug with the one here #1270469, this allowed to read cross-site files like authenticated javascript files and more.<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version: [ 95.0.4638.69] + [stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [ 95.0.4638.69] + [stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Linux, Debian 8]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Linux, Debian 8]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Below, i include a real proof of concept from a bug reported to Facebook, please keep this confidential. This poc demonstrates how STTF with a scroll detection would be used to extract information from pages that have XFO not set ( or frame-ancestors in csp). <span class="line"><!---->Below, i include a real proof of concept from a bug reported to Facebook, please keep this confidential. This poc demonstrates how STTF with a scroll detection would be used to extract information from pages that have XFO not set ( or frame-ancestors in csp). <!----></span><br><br>Things to note in this poc ( please ignore the reset since they are specific to the target ):<span class="line"><!---->Things to note in this poc ( please ignore the reset since they are specific to the target ):<!----></span><br><br>- Iframe open a Facebook close_popup<span class="line"><!---->- Iframe open a Facebook close_popup<!----></span><br>- close_popup calls opener.location.replace with the current URL in Iframe but with a fragment #:~:text=SearchTerm<span class="line"><!---->- close_popup calls opener.location.replace with the current URL in Iframe but with a fragment #:~:text=SearchTerm<!----></span><br>- Iframe location was changed due to a same-origin client-side redirect, STTF would work.<span class="line"><!---->- Iframe location was changed due to a same-origin client-side redirect, STTF would work.<!----></span><br>- The scroll happening in the top window, while the STTF match happened in the iframe.   <span class="line"><!---->- The scroll happening in the top window, while the STTF match happened in the iframe.   <!----></span><br>- The scroll id detected with the onscroll eventlistener ( could be enhanced to ignore user manual scrolls ) <span class="line"><!---->- The scroll id detected with the onscroll eventlistener ( could be enhanced to ignore user manual scrolls ) <!----></span><br><br><br>https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html"><!---->https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Youssef Sammouda<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Youssef Sammouda<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 2<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1270470#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by

        flackr: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->flackr: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.       </div><br>
    
        
      
        Mehdi, could you look into this? The TLDR is that whether scroll to text succeeded in a subframe is observable to the root frame due to the main frame scrolling. We should either always scroll the subframe into view regardless of whether scroll to text succeeded, or only scroll the subframe without scrolling the main frame to bring the subframe into view. I think the latter - not scrolling the main frame - is better because this is consistent with scrolling element fragment anchors into view - e.g. <span class="line"><!---->Mehdi, could you look into this? The TLDR is that whether scroll to text succeeded in a subframe is observable to the root frame due to the main frame scrolling. We should either always scroll the subframe into view regardless of whether scroll to text succeeded, or only scroll the subframe without scrolling the main frame to bring the subframe into view. I think the latter - not scrolling the main frame - is better because this is consistent with scrolling element fragment anchors into view - e.g. <!----></span>https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output"><!---->https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a><br>Author: David Bokan <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bokan &lt;<!----></span>bokan@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bokan@chromium.org"><!---->bokan@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 12 15:26:22 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 12 15:26:22 2022<!----></span><br><br>Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<span class="line"><!---->Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<!----></span><br><br>This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<span class="line"><!---->This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<!----></span><br><br>SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<span class="line"><!---->SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<!----></span><br>propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<span class="line"><!---->propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<!----></span><br>cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<span class="line"><!---->cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<!----></span><br>prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<span class="line"><!---->prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<!----></span><br>this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<span class="line"><!---->this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<!----></span><br>unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<span class="line"><!---->unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<!----></span><br>https://crrev.com/521ec7e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/521ec7e"><!---->https://crrev.com/521ec7e<!----></a><br><br>This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<span class="line"><!---->This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<!----></span><br>sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<span class="line"><!---->sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<!----></span><br>this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<span class="line"><!---->this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<!----></span><br>parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<span class="line"><!---->parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<!----></span><br>happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<span class="line"><!---->happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<!----></span><br>to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<span class="line"><!---->to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<!----></span><br><br>Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<span class="line"><!---->Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<!----></span><br>FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<span class="line"><!---->FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<!----></span><br>ElementFragmentAnchor.<span class="line"><!---->ElementFragmentAnchor.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1270470<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270470" title="Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature. "><!---->Bug: 1270470<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Id3aa57c7230ce737cd7f21cb2d8442cd093c3f2f<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Id3aa57c7230ce737cd7f21cb2d8442cd093c3f2f<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3378873<a class="undefined" target="_blank" In most<span class="line"><!---->propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<!----></span><br>cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<span class="line"><!---->cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<!----></span><br>prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<span class="line"><!---->prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<!----></span><br>this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<span class="line"><!---->this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<!----></span><br>unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<span class="line"><!---->unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<!----></span><br>https://crrev.com/521ec7e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/521ec7e"><!---->https://crrev.com/521ec7e<!----></a><br><br>This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<span class="line"><!---->This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<!----></span><br>sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<span class="line"><!---->sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<!----></span><br>this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<span class="line"><!---->this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<!----></span><br>parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<span class="line"><!---->parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<!----></span><br>happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<span class="line"><!---->happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<!----></span><br>to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<span class="line"><!---->to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<!----></span><br><br>Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<span class="line"><!---->Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<!----></span><br>FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<span class="line"><!---->FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<!----></span><br>ElementFragmentAnchor.<span class="line"><!---->ElementFragmentAnchor.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1270470<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270470" title="Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        mr-issue-page {

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;

          width: 100%;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1270470%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D3500" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1270470%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D3500%252526ust%25253D1703408652714244%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3ShhBwRaH9KDpt1J0yFWsz%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);

        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }

          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1270470: Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature. 
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1270470: Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature. 
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      tests...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/379861980" title="tests...@gmail.com"><!---->tests...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      tests...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->tests...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        Description #1 by tests...@gmail.com (Nov 15, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>The browser behavior when a Scroll to text fragment match is found is to scroll to the part of the page containing the text match and highlight it. <span class="line"><!---->The browser behavior when a Scroll to text fragment match is found is to scroll to the part of the page containing the text match and highlight it. <!----></span><br><br>What was discussed in the security docs about possible STTF attacks is a way to detect the scrolls to exfiltrate information via an attacker controlled iframe in the page or via network monitoring or lazy loaded image.    <span class="line"><!---->What was discussed in the security docs about possible STTF attacks is a way to detect the scrolls to exfiltrate information via an attacker controlled iframe in the page or via network monitoring or lazy loaded image.    <!----></span><br><br>However, what i found allowed to detect a scroll without the need to partially have control over the targeted page. This is possible - the bug explanation next - because Scroll To Text Fragment feature is also possible inside an iframe, a malicious actor can embed a targeted page in a website in an iframe ( with a query for an STTF ), position that iframe in a way to be in the bottom of the attacker web page, then detect a scroll on the top page using onscroll EventListener.    <span class="line"><!---->However, what i found allowed to detect a scroll without the need to partially have control over the targeted page. This is possible - the bug explanation next - because Scroll To Text Fragment feature is also possible inside an iframe, a malicious actor can embed a targeted page in a website in an iframe ( with a query for an STTF ), position that iframe in a way to be in the bottom of the attacker web page, then detect a scroll on the top page using onscroll EventListener.    <!----></span><br><br>The expected behavior here is that the scroll would happen inside the iframe only ,however , it also happens in the top window and the iframe ( or any levels below it if the STTF happened in an iframe inside the iframe ). <span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior here is that the scroll would happen inside the iframe only ,however , it also happens in the top window and the iframe ( or any levels below it if the STTF happened in an iframe inside the iframe ). <!----></span><br><br>Linking this bug with the one here #1270469, this allowed to read cross-site files like authenticated javascript files and more.<span class="line"><!---->Linking this bug with the one here #1270469, this allowed to read cross-site files like authenticated javascript files and more.<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version: [ 95.0.4638.69] + [stable]<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [ 95.0.4638.69] + [stable]<!----></span><br>Operating System: [Linux, Debian 8]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [Linux, Debian 8]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Below, i include a real proof of concept from a bug reported to Facebook, please keep this confidential. This poc demonstrates how STTF with a scroll detection would be used to extract information from pages that have XFO not set ( or frame-ancestors in csp). <span class="line"><!---->Below, i include a real proof of concept from a bug reported to Facebook, please keep this confidential. This poc demonstrates how STTF with a scroll detection would be used to extract information from pages that have XFO not set ( or frame-ancestors in csp). <!----></span><br><br>Things to note in this poc ( please ignore the reset since they are specific to the target ):<span class="line"><!---->Things to note in this poc ( please ignore the reset since they are specific to the target ):<!----></span><br><br>- Iframe open a Facebook close_popup<span class="line"><!---->- Iframe open a Facebook close_popup<!----></span><br>- close_popup calls opener.location.replace with the current URL in Iframe but with a fragment #:~:text=SearchTerm<span class="line"><!---->- close_popup calls opener.location.replace with the current URL in Iframe but with a fragment #:~:text=SearchTerm<!----></span><br>- Iframe location was changed due to a same-origin client-side redirect, STTF would work.<span class="line"><!---->- Iframe location was changed due to a same-origin client-side redirect, STTF would work.<!----></span><br>- The scroll happening in the top window, while the STTF match happened in the iframe.   <span class="line"><!---->- The scroll happening in the top window, while the STTF match happened in the iframe.   <!----></span><br>- The scroll id detected with the onscroll eventlistener ( could be enhanced to ignore user manual scrolls ) <span class="line"><!---->- The scroll id detected with the onscroll eventlistener ( could be enhanced to ignore user manual scrolls ) <!----></span><br><br><br>https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html"><!---->https://ysamm.com/ljezkjdlkezjdlkezjdez/fb_poc_sttf/bypass_iframe1.html<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Youssef Sammouda<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Youssef Sammouda<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Mehdi, could you look into this? The TLDR is that whether scroll to text succeeded in a subframe is observable to the root frame due to the main frame scrolling. We should either always scroll the subframe into view regardless of whether scroll to text succeeded, or only scroll the subframe without scrolling the main frame to bring the subframe into view. I think the latter - not scrolling the main frame - is better because this is consistent with scrolling element fragment anchors into view - e.g. <span class="line"><!---->Mehdi, could you look into this? The TLDR is that whether scroll to text succeeded in a subframe is observable to the root frame due to the main frame scrolling. We should either always scroll the subframe into view regardless of whether scroll to text succeeded, or only scroll the subframe without scrolling the main frame to bring the subframe into view. I think the latter - not scrolling the main frame - is better because this is consistent with scrolling element fragment anchors into view - e.g. <!----></span>https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output"><!---->https://jsbin.com/qoberuz/edit?html,css,js,output<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a><br>Author: David Bokan <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bokan &lt;<!----></span>bokan@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bokan@chromium.org"><!---->bokan@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 12 15:26:22 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 12 15:26:22 2022<!----></span><br><br>Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<span class="line"><!---->Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<!----></span><br><br>This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<span class="line"><!---->This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<!----></span><br><br>SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<span class="line"><!---->SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<!----></span><br>propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<span class="line"><!---->propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<!----></span><br>cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<span class="line"><!---->cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<!----></span><br>prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<span class="line"><!---->prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<!----></span><br>this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<span class="line"><!---->this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<!----></span><br>unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<span class="line"><!---->unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<!----></span><br>https://crrev.com/521ec7e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/521ec7e"><!---->https://crrev.com/521ec7e<!----></a><br><br>This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<span class="line"><!---->This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<!----></span><br>sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<span class="line"><!---->sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<!----></span><br>this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<span class="line"><!---->this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<!----></span><br>parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<span class="line"><!---->parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<!----></span><br>happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<span class="line"><!---->happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<!----></span><br>to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<span class="line"><!---->to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<!----></span><br><br>Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<span class="line"><!---->Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<!----></span><br>FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<span class="line"><!---->FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<!----></span><br>ElementFragmentAnchor.<span class="line"><!---->ElementFragmentAnchor.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1270470<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270470" title="Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature. "><!---->Bug: 1270470<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Id3aa57c7230ce737cd7f21cb2d8442cd093c3f2f<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Id3aa57c7230ce737cd7f21cb2d8442cd093c3f2f<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3378873<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31"><!---->908c81facdeca04307499e6539f13aac07375d31<!----></a><br>Author: David Bokan <<span class="line"><!---->Author: David Bokan &lt;<!----></span>bokan@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/bokan@chromium.org"><!---->bokan@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Jan 25 00:44:13 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jan 25 00:44:13 2022<!----></span><br><br>Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<span class="line"><!---->Refactor SafeToPropagateScrollToParent<!----></span><br><br>This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<span class="line"><!---->This is a refactor CL, there is no intended behavior change.<!----></span><br><br>SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<span class="line"><!---->SafeToPropagateScrollToParent is a bit on FrameView used to prevent<!----></span><br>propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<span class="line"><!---->propagating a ScrollIntoView operation across origin boundaries. In most<!----></span><br>cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<span class="line"><!---->cases, ScrollIntoView does propagate across these boundaries but we<!----></span><br>prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<span class="line"><!---->prevent it for fragment scrolls. Hence, when scrolling to a fragment,<!----></span><br>this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<span class="line"><!---->this bit is set on the first frame whose ancestor is cross-origin and<!----></span><br>unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<span class="line"><!---->unset when the ScrollIntoView is completed. This was added in:<!----></span><br>https://crrev.com/521ec7e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/521ec7e"><!---->https://crrev.com/521ec7e<!----></a><br><br>This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<span class="line"><!---->This is an awkward way to modify the behavior of ScrollIntoView since it<!----></span><br>sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<span class="line"><!---->sets state on an external object and the caller must remember to unset<!----></span><br>this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<span class="line"><!---->this state after the call. This CL replaces this mechanism with a<!----></span><br>parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<span class="line"><!---->parameter in ScrollIntoViewParams which causes the origin check to<!----></span><br>happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<span class="line"><!---->happen inside ScrollRectToVisible. Fragment scrolls use this parameter<!----></span><br>to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<span class="line"><!---->to prevent crossing origin boundaries.<!----></span><br><br>Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<span class="line"><!---->Note: The setting of the SafeToPropagateScrollToParent bit in<!----></span><br>FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<span class="line"><!---->FrameLoader was redundant as the bit gets set again from<!----></span><br>ElementFragmentAnchor.<span class="line"><!---->ElementFragmentAnchor.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d"><!---->4ca8a782c0d417000ea8010c2f9b72c7f674920d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1270470<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1270470" title="Security: Scrolls are detectable cross-site upon using the Scroll to text fragment feature.
